author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Hupper’s ‘Faces’ goes on view
text:
Hupper’s ‘Faces’ goes on view Sep 28, 2015 Photo by: Eve M. Hupper “Kelsea,” a portrait by Eve Hupper, is part of the “Faces of the Midcoast” show at Thomaston Public Library. 
Thomaston — Local photographer Eve M. Hupper will unveil a selection of her expressive portraits in an exhibition opening Monday, Oct. 5, at 11 a.m. at Thomaston Public Library, 60 Main St./Route 1. 
This will be the third local showing for the 23-year-old photographer and will focus on the unique textures and expressions found in the faces of local residents. Hupper selected her subjects carefully, spanning the ages of 19 to 52 and reflecting a wide variety of life experience. The photos to be exhibited are among the first to be taken in her newly opened studio in Room 210 of the historic Thomaston Academy building, which also houses the library. 
Light refreshments will be served at Monday’s opening, with Hupper and her subjects on hand to discuss the photos with guests. The “Faces of the Midcoast” exhibition will run through Oct. 12. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
